children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **ButtonGroup** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the ButtonGroup element from DOM.

parameters.name: value `String|Boolean`
parameters.description: The target value to be set or false to be removed.

parameters.name: button `Selector|Number`
parameters.description: The target button specified either as a jQuery selector/object or as an button index.

children.description: **Introduced in Q1 2013 SP** Sets a badge on one of the ButtonGroup buttons with the specified value. If invoked without parameters, returns the button's current badge value. Set the value to false to remove the badge.

children.name: selectOn
children.description: Sets the DOM event used to select the button. Accepts `"up"` as an alias for `touchend`, `mouseup` and `MSPointerUp` vendor specific events.By default, buttons are selected immediately after the user presses the button (on `touchstart` or `mousedown` or `MSPointerDown`, depending on the mobile device).However, if the widget is placed in a scrollable view, the user may accidentally press the button when scrolling. In such cases, it is recommended to set this option to `"up"`.

children.name: index
children.description: Defines the initially selected Button (zero based index).

children.name: enable
children.description: Defines if the widget is initially enabled or disabled.
